intro: Corchorus neocaledonicus var. neocaledonicus, commonly known as the New Caledonia spurge, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
